context_bundle.summary: SQL query optimization patterns with indexing strategies, CTEs, window functions, and performance tuning

common_patterns: Indexes: 'CREATE INDEX idx_user_email ON users(email); -- B-tree index for equality'
Composite index: 'CREATE INDEX idx_user_name_age ON users(last_name, first_name, age);'
CTE: 'WITH ranked AS (SELECT *, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY category ORDER BY price DESC) as rn FROM products) SELECT * FROM ranked WHERE rn <= 3;'
Window functions: 'SELECT name, salary, AVG(salary) OVER (PARTITION BY department) as dept_avg FROM employees;'
Subquery optimization: 'Use JOIN instead of IN: SELECT * FROM orders o JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id = c.id WHERE c.country = "US";'
EXPLAIN: 'EXPLAIN ANALYZE SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = "test@example.com"; -- check query plan'
Pagination: 'SELECT * FROM products WHERE id > $last_id ORDER BY id LIMIT 100; -- keyset pagination'
Batch operations: 'INSERT INTO users (name, email) VALUES ("Alice", "a@ex.com"), ("Bob", "b@ex.com"); -- bulk insert'
known_errors: slow query: Add indexes, check EXPLAIN plan, optimize WHERE clauses
full table scan: Add appropriate indexes, ensure statistics updated
N+1 queries: Use JOIN or batch loading to reduce queries
index not used: Check query matches index columns, update statistics
deadlock: Reduce transaction scope, access tables in consistent order
high memory usage: Limit result set size, use pagination
